citation.article-title: Deinobacterium chartae gen. nov., sp. nov., an extremely radiation-resistant, biofilm-forming bacterium isolated from a Finnish paper mill
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Deinobacterium (Dei.no.bac.te′ri.um. Gr. adj. deinos gigantic, unusual; L. neut. n. bacterium rod, N.L. neut. n. Deinobacterium an unusual bacterium).
Non-motile and endospores are not formed.
The major cellular fatty acids are branched 15 : 0 and 17 : 0 acids and the major polar lipid is an unknown aminophospholipid.
MK-8 is the major respiratory quinone and the peptidoglycan structure is A3β l-Orn–Gly–Gly.
The type species is Deinobacterium chartae.
